page.title: 04Wildlife,Cockerham Saltmarsh
page.content: In Summer many butterflies,including the migrant Painted Lady appear on the saltmarshes.The Natterjack Toad can be seen and also heard, especially in the breeding season. An occasional otter,fox,rabbit and other small mammals can also be seen. A plant,Marsh Samphire or Glasswort is found plentifully on the saltmarshes. The plants are still picked by some local people in August and September,and then boiled in water and served with a knob of butter or more popularly pickled in spiced vinegar. The foreshore is popular with anglers at various times,when eels are found in plenty.
